sub_topic: Identifying the Eulerian and Hamiltonian paths in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph: 

![graph image](https://i.imgur.com/9M1ZU6K.png)

Is there a Hamiltonian path in this graph? If yes, please provide the path. If not, explain why.
message_2:
A Hamiltonian path is a path in a graph that visits each vertex exactly once. In this graph, there is indeed a Hamiltonian path. One such path is:

A → B → C → D → E → F → G → H

This path visits each vertex exactly once, and thus, it is a Hamiltonian path.
